question: “Hear this word, you cows of Bashan, who are on the mountain of Samaria, who oppress the poor, who crush the needy, who say to your husbands, ‘Bring, that we may drink!’ (ESV)
“For the Lord GOD does nothing without revealing his secret to his servants the prophets. (ESV)

“Do two walk together, unless they have agreed to meet? (ESV)

“I hate, I despise your feasts, and I take no delight in your solemn assemblies. (ESV)

And he said: “The LORD roars from Zion and utters his voice from Jerusalem; the pastures of the shepherds mourn, and the top of Carmel withers.” (ESV)
Woe to you who desire the day of the LORD! Why would you have the day of the LORD? It is darkness, and not light, (ESV)
Is a trumpet blown in a city, and the people are not afraid? Does disaster come to a city, unless the LORD has done it? (ESV)
All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, who say, ‘Disaster shall not overtake or meet us.’ (ESV)
So I will send a fire upon the house of Hazael, and it shall devour the strongholds of Ben-hadad. (ESV)
“You only have I known of all the families of the earth; therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities. (ESV)

The words of Amos, who was among the shepherds(1) of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years(2) before the earthquake. Footnotes (1) 1:1 Or *sheep breeders* (2) 1:1 Or *during two years* (ESV)

And the LORD said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” And I said, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said, “Behold, I am setting a plumb line in the midst of my people Israel; I will never again pass by them; (ESV)
O you who turn justice to wormwood(1) and cast down righteousness to the earth! Footnotes (1) 5:7 Or *to bitter fruit* (ESV)
offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened, and proclaim freewill offerings, publish them; for so you love to do, O people of Israel!” declares the Lord GOD. (ESV)
Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they carried into exile a whole people to deliver them up to Edom. (ESV)
So I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, and it shall devour her strongholds. (ESV)
Therefore they shall now be the first of those who go into exile, and the revelry of those who stretch themselves out shall pass away.” (ESV)

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Tyre, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they delivered up a whole people to Edom, and did not remember the covenant of brotherhood. (ESV)
the high places of Isaac shall be made desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste, and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.” (ESV)
I will cut off the ruler from its midst, and will kill all its princes(1) with him,” says the LORD. Footnotes (1) 2:3 Or *officials* (ESV)
I will cut off the inhabitants from Ashdod, and him who holds the scepter from Ashkelon; I will turn my hand against Ekron, and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,” says the Lord GOD. (ESV)

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because he pursued his brother with the sword and cast off all pity, and his anger tore perpetually, and he kept his wrath forever. (ESV)
So I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, and it shall devour her strongholds.” (ESV)
and their king shall go into exile, he and his princes(1) together,” says the LORD. Footnotes (1) 1:15 Or *officials* (ESV)

I will turn your feasts into mourning and all your songs into lamentation; I will bring sackcloth on every waist and baldness on every head; I will make it like the mourning for an only son and the end of it like a bitter day. (ESV)
So I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour her strongholds, with shouting on the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind; (ESV)
So I will send a fire upon Teman, and it shall devour the strongholds of Bozrah.” (ESV)

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of the Ammonites, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they have ripped open pregnant women in Gilead, that they might enlarge their border. (ESV)
And if ten men remain in one house, they shall die. (ESV)

So that they may possess the remnant of Edom and all the nations that bear my name," declares the LORD, who will do these things."

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they have rejected the law of the LORD, and have not kept his statutes, but their lies have led them astray, those after which their fathers walked. (ESV)
The Lord GOD has sworn by himself, declares the LORD, the God of hosts: “I abhor the pride of Jacob and hate his strongholds, and I will deliver up the city and all that is in it.” (ESV)
The lion has roared; who will not fear? The Lord GOD has spoken; who can but prophesy?” (ESV)

“I also withheld the rain from you when there were yet three months to the harvest; I would send rain on one city, and send no rain on another city; one field would have rain, and the field on which it did not rain would wither; (ESV)

Thus says the LORD: “As the shepherd rescues from the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear, so shall the people of Israel who dwell in Samaria be rescued, with the corner of a couch and part(1) of a bed. Footnotes (1) 3:12 The meaning of the Hebrew word is uncertain (ESV)
those who trample the head of the poor into the dust of the earth and turn aside the way of the afflicted; a man and his father go in to the same girl, so that my holy name is profaned; (ESV)
For I know how many are your transgressions and how great are your sins— you who afflict the righteous, who take a bribe, and turn aside the needy in the gate. (ESV)
“I struck you with blight and mildew; your many gardens and your vineyards, your fig trees and your olive trees the locust devoured; yet you did not return to me,” declares the LORD. (ESV)

Therefore thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the Lord: “In all the squares there shall be wailing, and in all the streets they shall say, ‘Alas! Alas!’ They shall call the farmers to mourning and to wailing those who are skilled in lamentation, (ESV)
They shall wander from sea to sea, and from north to east; they shall run to and fro, to seek the word of the LORD, but they shall not find it. (ESV)
I will plant them on their land, and they shall never again be uprooted out of the land that I have given them,” says the LORD your God. (ESV)

“They do not know how to do right,” declares the LORD, “those who store up violence and robbery in their strongholds.” (ESV)

and in all vineyards there shall be wailing, for I will pass through your midst,” says the LORD. (ESV)
